analyzed: spṛhām ca utpādayiṣyanti tasmin buddhakṣetre

analyzed: te pi svapna antara gatāḥ amitābham tathāgatam drakṣyanti

analyzed: sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante

analyzed: a vaivartikāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ

translated: Here begins the Sukhāvatīvyūha Sūtra.

analyzed: tam ca bodhisattva gaṇam tān ca buddhakṣetra guṇa alaṃkāra vyūha saṃpad viśeṣān draṣṭum

analyzed: start sukhu
translated: Here begins the Sukhāvatīvyūha

analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām imam eva artham bhūyasyā mātrayā paridīpayan imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata

analyzed: sukhu vaidya

analyzed: bahu puṣpa pūṭī gṛhītvā te nānā varṇam manoramām
translated: Having taken many bundles of flowers, of various colors, fragrant, and delightful,

analyzed: okiranti nara nāyaka uttamam amita āyum naradeva pūjitam

original: tatha dakṣiṇapaścimottarāsu buddhāna kṣetrā daśatāsu yāttakāḥ /
analyzed: dakṣiṇa paścima uttarāsu buddhāna kṣetrāḥ daśatāsu yāttakāḥ
translated: In the same way, in the south, west, and north, in all the ten directions, as many buddha-fields as there are,

analyzed: okiranti nara nāyaka uttamam amita āyum naradeva pūjitam
translated: They scatter them over the supreme leader of men, Amitāyus, worshipped by gods and men.

original: pūjitva vā te bahubodhisattvā vanditva pādāmamitaprabhasya /
analyzed: pūjitvā vā te bahu bodhisattvāḥ vanditvā pādām amitaprabhasya
translated: Having paid homage to the many bodhisattvas, having bowed at the feet of the one of infinite splendor,

analyzed: pradakṣiṇīkṛtya vadanti ca evam aho dbhutam śobhati buddhakṣetram

analyzed: te udagra cittāḥ atulāya
translated: With uplifted minds, with incomparable joy, they again scatter flower bouquets,

analyzed: kāmam prabhāṣanti nāyake kṣetram siye evarūpam
translated: And joyfully proclaim in the presence of the leader: May our own field also become like this!

analyzed: ye puṣpapūṭāḥ iti tatra saṃsthihi yojanā śatam

analyzed: su alaṃkṛtam śobhati chādante buddhasya samanta kāyam

analyzed: sulabdha lābhāḥ khalu tehi sattvaiḥ śrutam nāma narottamasya

analyzed: su labdha pūrvāḥ yadā buddhakṣetram
translated: We too have obtained the gain well obtained, when we have gone to this Buddha-field.

analyzed: paśya atha svapna upama maitra kīdṛśam yat kalpitam kalpa sahasra śāstuḥ  sukhu vaidya
translated: Look, Maitreya, at the dream-like appearance of the Teacher's manifestation for a thousand aeons.

analyzed: paśya atha buddhāḥ vara puṇya rāśiḥ śobhati bodhisattvaiḥ

analyzed: amitābhasya ābhā amitā ca tejāḥ amitam ca āyūḥ amitaḥ ca saṃghaḥ  smitam karotī amita āyu nātham arciṣām
translated: The radiance of Amitābha is immeasurable, his splendor is immeasurable, his lifespan is immeasurable, and his saṅgha is immeasurable.🔽The Lord Amitāyus smiles, emitting thirty-six quintillion rays of light,

analyzed: ye niścaritvā sphūranti kṣetrāṇi sahasra koṭīḥ

analyzed: kaḥ hetuḥ atra kaḥ pratyayaḥ yena smitam kurvasi lokanātha

analyzed: tam vyākarohī yatra saḥ ṛtha kovidaḥ hita anukampī bahu sattva mocakaḥ

analyzed: śrutvā iti vācam paramām manoramām udagra cittāḥ bhaviṣyanti sattvāḥ

analyzed: aham pi sattvān bahu mocayeyam nāmena ghoṣeṇa tha darśanena

analyzed: sa śīghra śīghram tvaramāṇa rūpaḥ sukhāvatīm gacchatu lokadhātum

analyzed: ca pūrvam amitaprabhasya pūjetu sahasra koṭīḥ

analyzed: buddhāna koṭī bahu pūjayitvā ṛddhī balena bahu kṣetra
translated: Having made offerings to many koṭīs of buddhas, having gone to many realms by the power of his supernormal abilities,

analyzed: pūjām sugatāna santike bhaktyā gamiṣyanti sukhāvatītaḥ

analyzed: iti

analyzed: start sukhu

translated: Its branches, leaves, and foliage hang down eight hundred yojanas. Its root-entwining rises five hundred yojanas.

analyzed: kiṅkiṇī maṇi jāla sauvarṇa sarva ratna alaṃkāra vibhūṣitaḥ yathā āśaya sattva vijñapti samalaṃkṛtaḥ ca  tasya khalu punar ānanda bodhi vṛkṣasya vāta samīritasya yaḥ śabdaḥ ghoṣaḥ niścarati saḥ u parimāṇān lokadhātūn vijñāpayati
translated: It was adorned with nets of jewel bells, gold, and all jewels, and adorned according to the wishes and expressions of beings.🔽And, Ananda, when the Bodhi tree was stirred by the wind, the sound, the voice that issued forth made itself heard in immeasurable world systems.

original: tatrānanda yeṣāṃ sattvānāṃ sa bodhivṛkṣaḥ śrotrāvabhāsamāgacchati /
analyzed: tatra ānanda yeṣām sattvānām sa bodhivṛkṣaḥ śrotra avabhāsam āgacchati
translated: And, Ananda, those beings who came within the range of hearing of that Bodhi tree,

analyzed: teṣām śrotra rogaḥ na pratikāṅkṣitavyaḥ yāvat bodhi paryantam
translated: They should not expect to have any eye disease until the end of enlightenment.

analyzed: yeṣām aprameya asaṃkhyeya acintya atulya amāpya aparimāṇa anabhilāpyānām sattvānām sa bodhivṛkṣaḥ cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam āgacchati
translated: For those beings whose number is immeasurable, incalculable, inconceivable, incomparable, vast, limitless, and inexpressible, that Bodhi tree appears to the eye.

analyzed: teṣām cakṣūḥ rogaḥ na pratikāṅkṣitavyaḥ yāvat bodhi paryantam
translated: They should not expect to have any eye disease until the end of enlightenment.

analyzed: ye khalu punar ānanda sattvāḥ tatas bodhivṛkṣāt gandham jighranti
translated: Ānanda, those beings who smell the fragrance from that Bodhi tree,

original: teṣāṃ yāvadbodhiparyantaṃ na jātu ghrāṇaroagaḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām yāvat bodhi paryantam na jātu ghrāṇa roagaḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyaḥ
translated: they should not expect to have any nose disease until the end of enlightenment.

analyzed: ye sattvāḥ tatas bodhi vṛkṣat phalāni āsvādayanti
translated: Those beings who taste the fruits from that Bodhi tree,

original: teṣāṃ yāvadbodhiparyantaṃ na jātu jihvārogaḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām yāvat bodhi paryantam na jātu jihvā rogaḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyaḥ
translated: they should not expect to have any tongue disease until the end of enlightenment.

original: ye sattvāstasya bodhivṛkṣasyābhayā sphuṭā Sukhv / Vaidya
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ tasya bodhi vṛkṣasya ābhayā sphuṭā sukhu vaidya
translated: Those beings who are pervaded by the light of that Bodhi tree and become happy,

original: bhavanti / teṣāṃ yāvadbodhiparyantaṃ na jātu kāyarogaḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyaḥ /
analyzed: bhavanti teṣām yāvat bodhi paryantam na jātu kāya rogaḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyaḥ
translated: they should not expect to have any body disease until the end of enlightenment.

analyzed: ye ca khalu punar ānanda sattvāḥ tam bodhivṛkṣam dharmataḥ nidhyāyanti
translated: Ānanda, those beings who contemplate that Bodhi tree in terms of the Dharma,

analyzed: teṣām tatas upādāya yāvat bodhi paryantam na jātu citta vikṣepaḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyaḥ
translated: From that time onward, up to the end of the bodhisattva path, they should never expect any distraction of mind.

original: sarve ca te sattvāḥ sahadarśanāttasya bodhivṛkṣasyāvaivartikāḥ saṃtiṣṭhante yadutānuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te sattvāḥ saha darśanāt tasya bodhivṛkṣasya a vaivartikāḥ saṃtiṣṭhante yat uta anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: And all those beings, upon seeing that Bodhi tree, become irreversible from the highest complete enlightenment.

analyzed: tisraḥ ca kṣāntīḥ pratilabhante yat idam ghoṣa anugām anulomikīm anutpattika dharma kṣāntim

translated: He said, Just as the gods of the Thirty-Three or the Yāma gods, having entered celestial palaces of fifty leagues or a hundred leagues, play, enjoy, and amuse themselves.

original: evamevāhaṃ bhagavan atra sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāveteṣāṃ manuṣyāṇāmudāreṣu padmeṣu garbhāvāsaṃ paśyāmi // //
analyzed: evam eva aham bhagavan atra sukhāvatyām lokadhātau eteṣām manuṣyāṇām udāreṣu padmeṣu garbhāvāsam paśyāmi
translated: In this way, Blessed One, I see these humans in the delightful world system residing in the womb in those magnificent lotuses.”

analyzed: start sukhu
translated: The Sūtra of the Questions of Ajita

original: santi khalu punaratra bhagavan sattvā ya aupapādukāḥ padmeṣu paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhavanti /🔽tatko 'tra bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo yadanye garbhāvāsaṃ prativasanti /
analyzed: santi khalu punar atra bhagavan sattvāḥ ye aupapādukāḥ padmeṣu paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhavanti  tat kaḥ tra bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat anye garbhāvāsam prativasanti
translated: “Moreover, Blessed One, there are beings here who are spontaneously born, appearing cross-legged in lotuses.

analyzed: anye punar aupapādukāḥ padmeṣu paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhavanti
translated: What, Blessed One, is the cause and what is the condition for some to reside in the womb and others to be spontaneously born, appearing cross-legged in lotuses?”

original: bhagavānāha ye te ajita bodhisattvā anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sthitāḥ sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapattaye vicikitsāmutpādayanti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha ye te ajita bodhisattvāḥ anyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu sthitāḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapattaye vicikitsām utpādayanti
translated: The Blessed One said, “Ajita, those bodhisattvas who are in other buddha-fields and give rise to doubt about being reborn in the delightful world system,

analyzed: tena cittena kuśala mūlāni avaropayanti
translated: and who plant roots of virtue with that mind,

analyzed: teṣām atra garbhāvāsaḥ bhavati
translated: they have a womb-residence here.

original: ye punarnirvicikitsāmutpādya cchinnakāṅkṣāḥ sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapattaye kuśalamūlānyavaropayanti /
analyzed: ye punar niḥ vicikitsām utpādya chinna kāṅkṣāḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapattaye kuśala mūlāni avaropayanti
translated: But those who, having given rise to doubt, cut off their wishes and plant roots of virtue for rebirth in the delightful world system,

analyzed: buddhānām bhagavatām asaṅga jñānam eva a kalpayanti abhiśraddadhati adhimucyante
translated: They conceive of and have faith in and aspire to the unobstructed knowledge of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

analyzed: te aupapādukāḥ padmeṣu paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhavanti
translated: They are spontaneously born, appearing on lotus blossoms in full lotus posture.

original: ye te ajita bodhisattvā mahāsattvā anyatra buddhakṣetreṣu sthitāścittamutpādayanti amitābhasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya /
analyzed: ye te ajita bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ anyatra buddhakṣetreṣu sthitāḥ cittam utpādayanti amitābhasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya darśanāya
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are established elsewhere in buddha-fields and generate the thought to see the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Amitābha,

analyzed: na vicikitsām utpādayanti
translated: do not give rise to doubt.

analyzed: na kāṅkṣanti asaṅgam buddha jñānam
translated: They do not doubt the unobstructed buddha-knowledge.

analyzed: sva kuśala mūlam ca abhiśraddadhati
translated: They have faith in their own roots of virtue.

original: teṣāmaupapādukānāṃ paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhūtānāṃ muhūrtamātreṇa evaṃrūpaḥ kāyo bhavati tadyathānyeṣāṃ ciropapannānāṃ sattvānām /
analyzed: teṣām aupapādukānām paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhūtānām muhūrta mātreṇa evaṃrūpaḥ kāyaḥ bhavati tat yathā anyeṣām cira upapannānām sattvānām
translated: For those who are spontaneously born, appearing on lotus blossoms in full lotus posture, in just a moment their bodies become like those of other beings who have been born there for a long time.

original: paśya ajita prajñāviśeṣaṃ prajñāvaimātryaṃ prajñāparihāṇiṃ prajñāparīttatām yattu
analyzed: paśya ajita prajñā viśeṣam prajñā vaimātryam prajñā parihāṇim prajñā parītta tām  yat tu
translated: See, Ajita, the difference in wisdom, the disparity in wisdom, the loss of wisdom, the paucity of wisdom, which

analyzed: hitāya pañca varṣa śatāni parihīṇāḥ bhavanti buddha darśanāt bodhisattva darśanāt dharma śravaṇāt dharma saṃkathanāt
translated: for five hundred years has been detrimental to seeing the Buddha, seeing the bodhisattvas, hearing the Dharma, and discussing the Dharma.

original: kuśalamūlacaryāyāḥ parihīṇā bhavanti sarvakuśalamūlasaṃpattibhiḥ yadidaṃ vicikitsāpatitaiḥ saṃjñāmanasikāraiḥ /
analyzed: kuśala mūla caryāyāḥ parihīṇāḥ bhavanti sarva kuśala mūla saṃpattibhiḥ yat idam vicikitsā patitaiḥ saṃjñā manasikāraiḥ
translated: They are deprived of the practice of the roots of virtue and of all the excellences of the roots of virtue, due to the thoughts and concepts that fall into doubt.

original: tadyathāpi nāma ajita rājñaḥ kṣatriyasya mūrdhābhiṣiktasya bandhanāgāraṃ bhavetsarvasauvarṇavaiḍūryapratyuptamavasaktapaṭṭamālyadāmakalāpaṃ
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma ajita rājñaḥ kṣatriyasya mūrdhābhiṣiktasya bandhanāgāram bhavet sarva sauvarṇa vaiḍūrya pratyuptam avasakta paṭṭamālya dāma kalāpam
translated: “Ajita, it is as follows. Suppose there were a prison of a king who has been consecrated with water, made entirely of gold and beryl, hung with silk tassels, garlands, and wreaths,

analyzed: nānā raṅga vibhava vitānam dūṣya paṭṭa saṃchannam nānā puṣpa kusuma abhikīrṇam udāra dhūpa nirdhūpitam
translated: with canopies of various colors, covered with calico cloth, strewn with various flowers, and perfumed with incense.

analyzed: prāsāda harmya niryūha gavākṣa vedikā toraṇa vicitram sapta ratnam kiṅkiṇī jāla saṃchannam
translated: It has towers, terraces, windows, balconies, and archways made of the seven precious substances, and is covered with nets of bells.

analyzed: catur asram catur sthūṇam catur dvāram catur sopānam
translated: It is square, with four pillars, four doors, and four staircases.

original: tatra tasya sa rājñaḥ putraḥ kenacideva kṛtyena prakṣipya jāmbūnadasuvarṇamayairnigaḍairbaddho bhavati /
analyzed: tatra tasya sa rājñaḥ putraḥ kenacid eva kṛtyena prakṣipya jāmbūnada suvarṇa mayaiḥ nigaḍaiḥ baddhaḥ bhavati
translated: There, the king’s son is thrown into that prison for some reason and is bound with shackles made of pure gold.

original: tasya ca tatra paryaṅkaḥ prajñaptaḥ syādanekagoṇikāstīrṇastūlikāparṇakāstīrṇaḥ kāliṅgaprāvaraṇapratyāstaraṇasottarapadacchada ubhayāntalohitopadhānaścitro
analyzed: tasya ca tatra paryaṅkaḥ prajñaptaḥ syāt aneka goṇikā āstīrṇaḥ tūlikā parṇaka āstīrṇaḥ kāliṅga prāvaraṇa pratyāstaraṇa sa uttara padacchadaḥ ubhaya anta lohita upadhānaḥ citraḥ
translated: And there a couch would be prepared for him, covered with many woolen blankets, with cotton wadding and woolen covers, with coverings from Kāliṅga, with a canopy above and red bolsters at both ends,

analyzed: darśanīyaḥ
translated: colorful and beautiful.

original: sa tatra tadābhiṣaṇṇo vā abhisaṃpanno vā bhavet /
analyzed: sa tatra tadā abhiṣaṇṇaḥ vā abhisaṃpannaḥ vā bhavet
translated: And he would be lying down there, either asleep or drunk.

original: bahu cāsyānekavidhaṃ śuci vinītaṃ pānabhojanaṃ tatropanāmyeta /
analyzed: bahu ca asya anekavidham śuci vinītam pāna bhojanam tatra upanāmyeta
translated: And many kinds of pure, well-prepared drinks and food would be presented to him there.

original: tatkiṃ manyase ajita udārastasya rājaputrasya sa paribhogo bhavet /
analyzed: tat kim manyase ajitaḥ udāraḥ tasya rāja putrasya sa paribhogaḥ bhavet
translated: What do you think, Ajita, would that prince's enjoyment be extensive?

analyzed: ajitaḥ āha udāraḥ bhagavan
translated: Ajita said, Extensive, Blessed One.

original: bhagavānāha tatkiṃ manyase ajita api tvāsvādayettatra niśāmayecca /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat kim manyase ajita api tu āsvādayet tatra niśāmayet ca
translated: The Blessed One said, What do you think, Ajita, would he enjoy it there and take delight in it,

analyzed: tena vā tuṣṭim vidyāt
translated: or would he know satisfaction in that?

analyzed: āha no hi idam bhagavan
translated: He said, No, Blessed One.

original: api tu khalu punaryadyapanītya rājñā tatra bandhanāgāre prakṣipto bhavet /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar yadi apanītya rājñā tatra bandhanāgāre prakṣiptaḥ bhavet
translated: But rather, if the king were to have him thrown into prison there,

analyzed: sa tatas mokṣam eva ākāṅkṣet
translated: he would only long for release from that.

original: abhijātān kumārānamātyān stryāgārān śreṣṭhino gṛhapatīn koṭṭarājāṃśca paryeṣayet /
analyzed: abhijātān kumārān amātyān stryāgārān śreṣṭhinaḥ gṛhapatīn koṭṭarājān ca paryeṣayet
translated: He would seek out the noble princes, ministers, women of the harem, chief counselors, householders, and vassal kings.

analyzed: ye enam tatas bandhanāgārāt parimocayeyuḥ
translated: Those who would liberate him from that prison,

original: kiṃcāpi bhagavaṃstasya rājakumārasya tatra bandhānāgāre nābhiratiḥ /
analyzed: kiṃca api bhagavan tasya rāja kumārasya tatra bandhānāgāre na abhiratiḥ
translated: even though the prince has no delight in that prison,

analyzed: na atra parimucyate
translated: he is not liberated from there.

analyzed: yāvat na rājā prasādam upadarśayati
translated: As long as the king does not show favor,

original: bhagavānāha evameva ajita ye te bodhisattvā vicikitsāpatitāḥ kuśalamūlānyavaropayanti / Sukhv / Vaidya
analyzed: bhagavān āha evam eva ajita ye te bodhisattvāḥ vicikitsā patitāḥ kuśala mūlāni avaropayanti sukhu vaidya
translated: the Blessed One said, Just so, Ajita, those bodhisattvas who, having fallen into doubt, plant wholesome roots,

analyzed: kāṅkṣati buddha jñānam
translated: long for the knowledge of a Buddha,

original: kiṃcāpi tena buddhanāmaśravaṇena tena ca cittaprasādamātreṇa atra sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapadyante /
analyzed: kiṃca api tena buddha nāma śravaṇena tena ca citta prasāda mātreṇa atra sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapadyante
translated: even though by hearing the name of the Buddha and by that mere faith in the mind, they are reborn in that world-system Sukhāvatī,

original: na tu khalvaupapādukāḥ padmeṣu paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhavanti /🔽api tu padmeṣu garbhāvāsaṃ prativasanti /
analyzed: na tu khalu aupapādukāḥ padmeṣu paryaṅkaiḥ prādurbhavanti  api tu padmeṣu garbhāvāsam prativasanti
translated: but they are not born spontaneously in lotuses on thrones.🔽Rather, they dwell in the womb in lotuses.

analyzed: kiṃca api teṣām tatra udyāna vimāna saṃjñāḥ saṃtiṣṭhante  na asti uccāra prasrāvam
translated: Even though they have the notion of gardens and palaces there,🔽there is no urine or excrement.

analyzed: na asti kheṭa siṃhāṇakam
translated: There is no nasal mucus or phlegm.

analyzed: na pratikūlam manasaḥ pravartate
translated: Nothing disagreeable occurs to the mind.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ pañca varṣaśatāni virahitā bhavanti buddhadarśanena dharmaśravaṇena bodhisattvadarśanena dharmasāṃkathyaviniścayena sarvakuśalamūlena
analyzed: api tu khalu punar pañca varṣa śatāni virahitāḥ bhavanti buddha darśanena dharma śravaṇena bodhisattva darśanena dharma sāṃkathya viniścayena sarva kuśala mūlena
translated: Moreover, they are separated for five hundred years from seeing a Buddha, from hearing the Dharma, from seeing a bodhisattva, from the certainty of discussion of the Dharma, and from all roots of virtue.

analyzed: dharma caryābhiḥ ca
translated: They are also separated from the practice of the Dharma.

original: kiṃcāpi te tatra nābhiramante na tuṣṭiṃ vijānanti /
analyzed: kiṃca api te tatra na abhiramante na tuṣṭim vijānanti
translated: Even though they do not delight in that, they do not know satisfaction.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ pūrvāparān kṣapayitsate bhūyastataḥ paścānniskrāmanti /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar pūrva aparān kṣapayitsate bhūyas tatas paścāt niskrāmanti
translated: Moreover, they spend their time there and then leave again.

original: na caiṣāṃ tato niṣkrāmatāṃ niṣkramaḥ prajñāyate ūrdhvamadhastiryagvā /
analyzed: na ca eṣām tatas niṣkrāmatām niṣkramaḥ prajñāyate ūrdhvam adhas tiryak vā
translated: But when they leave there, their leaving is not known to be upwards, downwards, or sideways.

original: paśya ajita etarhi nāma pañcabhirvarṣaśatairbahūni buddhakoṭīniyutaśatasahasropasthānāni syurbahvaparimāṇāsaṃkhyeyāprameyāṇi ca kuśalamūlānyavaropayitavyāni
analyzed: paśya ajitaḥ etarhi nāma pañcabhiḥ varṣa śataiḥ bahūni buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasra upasthānāni syuḥ bahu aparimāṇa asaṃkhyeya aprameyāṇi ca kuśala mūlāni avaropayitavyāni
translated: Look, Ajita! In this way, after five hundred years, there will be many trillions of Buddhas to attend upon, and many immeasurable, incalculable, and innumerable roots of virtue to plant.

analyzed: tat sarvam vicikitsā doṣeṇa vināśayanti
translated: But all that is destroyed by the fault of doubt.

original: paśya ajita kiyanmahate 'narthāya bodhisattvānāṃ vicikitsā saṃvartata iti /
analyzed: paśya ajita kiyat mahate narthāya bodhisattvānām vicikitsā saṃvartate iti
translated: Look, Ajita! How great is the harm that doubt brings to bodhisattvas!

original: tasmāttarhi ajita bodhisattvairnirvicikitsairbodhaye cittamutpādya kṣipraṃ sarvasattvahitasukhādhānāya
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ajita bodhisattvaiḥ nirvicikitsaiḥ bodhaye cittam utpādya kṣipram sarva sattva hita sukha ādhānāya
translated: Therefore, Ajita, bodhisattvas who are free from doubt should generate the mind directed towards enlightenment and quickly generate the mind directed towards enlightenment in order to bring about the welfare and happiness of all beings.

analyzed: sāmarthya pratilambha artham sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapattaye kuśala mūlāni pariṇāmayitavyāni
translated: Therefore, Ajita, bodhisattvas who are free from doubt, having generated the mind for enlightenment, should quickly dedicate their roots of virtue to rebirth in the world system Sukhāvatī in order to attain the ability to bring about the welfare and happiness of all beings.

analyzed: yatra bhagavān amitābhaḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: Where the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Amitābha...

analyzed: start sukhu
translated: Sukhavati

original: evamukte ajito bodhisattvo bhagavantametadavocat kiṃ punarbhagavan bodhisattvā
analyzed: evam ukte ajitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kim punar bhagavan bodhisattvā
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva Ajita said to the Blessed One, But, Blessed One, will bodhisattvas

original: ito buddhakṣetrātpariniṣpannā anyeṣāṃ vā buddhānāṃ bhagavatāmantikātsukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapatsyante /
analyzed: itas buddhakṣetrāt pariniṣpannāḥ anyeṣām vā buddhānām bhagavatām antikāt sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: who have perfected themselves in this buddha-field or in the presence of other Blessed Buddhas be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī?

original: bhagavānāha ito hyajita buddhakṣetrād dvāsaptatikoṭīniyutāni bodhisattvānāṃ pariniṣpannāni
analyzed: bhagavān āha itas hi ajita buddhakṣetrāt dvāsaptati koṭī niyutāni bodhisattvānām pariniṣpannāni
translated: The Blessed One said, Ajita, from this buddha-field, seventy-two koṭis of niyutas of bodhisattvas who have perfected themselves

analyzed: yāni sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante pariniṣpannānām avaivartikānām bahu buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi avaropitaiḥ kuśala mūlaiḥ
translated: will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī, of those who have perfected themselves and are irreversible, with roots of virtue planted by many hundreds of thousands of koṭis of niyutas of Buddhas.

original: kaḥ punarvādastataḥ parīttataraiḥ kuśalamūlaiḥ duṣprasahasya tathāgatasyāntikādaṣṭādaśakoṭīniyutaśatāni bodhisattvānāṃ sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapatsyante
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ tatas parīttataraiḥ kuśala mūlaiḥ duṣprasahasya tathāgatasya antikāt aṣṭādaśa koṭī niyuta śatāni bodhisattvānām sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: How much more so for those with even smaller roots of virtue! From the presence of the Tathāgata Duṣprasaha, eighteen quintillion bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī.

original: pūrvāntare digbhāge ratnākaro nāma tathāgato viharati /
analyzed: pūrva antare digbhāge ratnākaraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ viharati
translated: In the eastern direction, the Tathāgata Ratnākara resides.

analyzed: tasya antikāt navati bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: From his presence, ninety quintillion bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: jyotiṣprabhasya tathāgatasya antikāt dvāviṃśati bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante  amitaprabhasya tathāgatasya antikāt pañcaviṃśati bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: From the presence of the Tathāgata Jyotiṣprabha, twenty-two quintillion bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī.🔽From the presence of the Tathāgata Amitaprabha, twenty-five quintillion bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: lokapradīpasya tathāgatasya antikāt ṣaṣṭi bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: From the presence of the Tathāgata Lokapradīpa, sixty quintillion bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: nāgābhibhuvaḥ tathāgatasya antikāt catuḥṣaṣṭiḥ bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: From the presence of the Tathāgata Nāgābhibhū, sixty-four quintillion bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: virajaḥprabhasya tathāgatasya antikāt pañcaviṃśati bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: Twenty-five koṭis of bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī from the presence of the Tathāgata Virajo-prabha.

analyzed: siṃhasya tathāgatasya antikāt ṣoḍaśa bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: Sixteen koṭis of bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī from the presence of the Tathāgata Siṃha.

analyzed: siṃhasya tathāgatasya antikāt aṣṭādaśa bodhisattva sahasrāni sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatasyante
translated: Eighteen thousand bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī from the presence of the Tathāgata Siṃha.

analyzed: śrīkūṭasya tathāgatasya antikāt ekāśīti bodhisattva koṭī niyutāni sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: Eighty-four koṭis of niyutas of bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī from the presence of the Tathāgata Śrī-kūṭa.

analyzed: narendra rājasya tathāgatasya antikāt daśa bodhisattva koṭī niyutāni sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: Ten koṭis of niyutas of bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī from the presence of the Tathāgata Narendra-rāja.

analyzed: balābhijñasya tathāgatasya antikāt dvādaśa bodhisattva sahasrāṇi sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante  puṣpa dhvajasya sukhu vaidya
translated: Twelve thousand bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī from the presence of the Tathāgata Balābhijña.

analyzed: tathāgatasya antikāt pañcaviṃśatiḥ vīrya prāptāḥ bodhisattva koṭyaḥ eka prasthāna prasthitā
translated: Fifty koṭis of bodhisattvas who have attained heroism and are intent on a single departure will be reborn in the world system Sukhāvatī from the presence of the Tathāgata Puṣpa-dhvaja.

original: ekenāṣṭāhena navatikalpakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi paścānmukhīkṛtya sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapatsyante /🔽jvalanādhipatestathāgatasyāntikāddvādaśabodhisattvakoṭyaḥ sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātāvupapatsyante /
analyzed: ekena aṣṭa ahena navati kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi paścāt mukhīkṛtya sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante  jvalanādhipateḥ tathāgatasya antikāt dvādaśa bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante

analyzed: vaiśāradyaprāptasya tathāgatasya antikāt ekonasaptati bodhisattva koṭyaḥ sukhāvatyām lokadhātau upapatsyante
translated: From the Tathāgata Vaiśāradyaprāpta, sixty-nine hundred million bodhisattvas will be reborn in the world system called Sukhāvatī

original: amitābhasya tathāgatasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya paripṛcchanāya paripraśnīkaraṇāya /🔽etena ajita paryāyeṇa paripūrṇakalpakoṭīniyutaṃ nāmadheyāni parikīrtayeyaṃ teṣāṃ
analyzed: amitābhasya tathāgatasya darśanāya vandanāya paryupāsanāya paripṛcchanāya paripraśnīkaraṇāya  etena ajita paryāyeṇa paripūrṇa kalpa koṭī niyutam nāmadheyāni parikīrtayeyam teṣām
translated: in order to see, venerate, serve, and attend upon the Tathāgata Amitābha, and to ask questions and receive answers.

original: tathāgatānāṃ yebhyaste bodhisattvā upasaṃkrāmanti sukhāvatyāṃ lokadhātau tamamitābhaṃ
analyzed: tathāgatānām yebhyaḥ te bodhisattvāḥ upasaṃkrāmanti sukhāvatyām lokadhātau tam amita ābham

analyzed: tathāgatam draṣṭum vanditu paryupāsitum
translated: in order to see the Tathāgata Amitābha, to venerate him, to serve him, and to attend upon him,

analyzed: na śakyaḥ ca paryantaḥ dhigantum
translated: for a full hundred thousand quintillion eons, but I would not be able to finish.

analyzed: start sukhu
translated: Sukhavativyuha

original: paśya ajita kiyatsulabdhalābhāste sattvā ye 'mitābhasya tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya nāmadheyaṃ śroṣyanti /
analyzed: paśya ajita kiyat su labdha lābhāḥ te sattvāḥ ye mitābhasya tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya nāmadheyam śroṣyanti
translated: Ajita, consider how much gain there is for those beings who will hear the name of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Amitābha.

original: nāpi te sattvā hīnādhimuktikā bhaviṣyanti ye 'ntaśaekacittaprasādamapi tasmiṃstathāgate 'bhilapyante /
analyzed: na api te sattvāḥ hīna adhimuktikāḥ bhaviṣyanti ye tasmin tathāgate bhilapyante
translated: Those beings will not have inferior aspirations, if they utter even one thought of faith in that Tathāgata.

analyzed: asmin ca dharmaparyāye
translated: And in this Dharma discourse.

analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ajitaḥ ārocayāmi vaḥ
translated: Therefore, Ajita, I proclaim to you.

original: prativedayāmi sadevakasya lokasya purato 'sya dharmaparyāyasya śrāvaṇāya /
analyzed: prativedayāmi sa devakasya lokasya puratas sya dharmaparyāyasya śrāvaṇāya
translated: I make it known in the presence of the world with its gods that this Dharma discourse should be heard.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: bodhisattvakoṭyo hyajita aśravaṇādeṣāmevaṃrūpāṇāṃ dharmaparyāyāṇāṃ vivartante 'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattva koṭyaḥ hi ajita a śravaṇāt eṣām evaṃrūpāṇām dharmaparyāyāṇām vivartante nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: Ajita, because of not hearing these kinds of Dharma discourses, koṭis of bodhisattvas turn back from highest genuine full Awakening.

original: tasmādasya dharmaparyāyasyādhyāśayena śravaṇodgrahaṇadhāraṇārthaṃ paryāvāptaye vistareṇa saṃprakāśāya bhāvanārthaṃ ca sumahadvīryamārabdhavyam
analyzed: tasmāt asya dharmaparyāyasya adhyāśayena śravaṇa udgrahaṇa dhāraṇa artham paryāvāptaye vistareṇa saṃprakāśāya bhāvanā artham ca su mahat vīryam ārabdhavyam
translated: Therefore, with the highest intention, in order to listen to, take up, remember, and fully understand this Dharma teaching, and in order to explain it extensively and cultivate it, one should undertake great effort.

analyzed: antaśas eka rātriṃdinam api
translated: At least for one night and day.

analyzed: eka godoha mātram api

analyzed: antaśas pustaka avaropitam kṛtvā su likhitaḥ dhārayitavyaḥ

original: śāstṛsaṃjñā ca tatropādhyāye kartavyā ya icchati kṣipramaparimitān sattvānavaivartikatve 'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ pratiṣṭhāpayitum /

translated: And the teacher should be regarded as the Teacher, if one wishes to quickly establish innumerable beings in irreversibility towards highest complete enlightenment.

original: tacca tasya bhagavato 'mitābhasya tathāgatasya buddhakṣetraṃ draṣṭum /
analyzed: tat ca tasya bhagavataḥ mitābhasya tathāgatasya buddhakṣetram draṣṭum
translated: And to see that Buddha-field of the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Amitābha,

analyzed: ātmanaḥ ca viśiṣṭām buddhakṣetra guṇa alaṃkāra vyūha saṃpadam parigrahītum iti
translated: And to obtain for oneself the excellent perfection of the array of qualities of a Buddha-field.

original: api tu khalu ajita atyarthaṃ sulabdhalābhāste sattvā avaropitakuśalamūlāḥ pūrvajinakṛtādhikārā buddhādhiṣṭhitāśca bhaviṣyanti /

analyzed: yeṣām anāgate dhvani yāvat saddharma vipralope vartamāne ime evaṃrūpāḥ udārāḥ dharmaparyāyāḥ

translated: praised by all Buddhas, extolled by all Buddhas, approved by all Buddhas,

analyzed: kṣipram āhārakāḥ śrotra avabhāsam āgamiṣyanti

translated: Having heard them, they will attain vast joy and delight, they will receive them, retain them, recite them, master them, and explain them in detail to others.

analyzed: antaśas likhitvā pūjayiṣyanti

analyzed: bahu ca te puṇyam prasaviṣyanti

analyzed: yasya na sukarā saṃkhyā kartum

analyzed: iti hi ajita yat tathāgatena kartavyam kṛtam mayā
translated: Thus, Ajita, whatever should be done by a Tathāgata, I have done it.

analyzed: yuṣmābhiḥ idānīm nirvicikitsa yogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ

analyzed: mā saṃśayata asaṅgam anāvaraṇam buddha jñānam

analyzed: mā bhūt sarva ākāra avaropita ratna maye bandhanāgāre praveśaḥ

analyzed: yūyam idānīm abhiyujyata pratipadyadhvam

analyzed: a vipraṇāśāya buddha dharmāṇām an antardhānāya parākramiṣyatha

analyzed: mā tathāgata ājñām kṣobhayiṣyatha
translated: Do not disturb the Tathāgata's command.

analyzed: start sukhu

analyzed: sukhu vaidya
translated: Sukhāvatīvyūha

translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these verses on that occasion:

analyzed: ye tu te śūra siddhārthāḥ śroṣyanti ca imām giram

analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ yaiḥ ca hi saṃbuddhaḥ lokanāthaḥ prabhaṃkaraḥ

analyzed: sa gauravaiḥ śrutaḥ dharmaḥ prītim prāpsyanti te parām

analyzed: na śakta kusīda dṛṣṭibhiḥ buddhāna dharmeṣu prasāda vinditum
translated: Those with inferior views and laziness are not able to have faith in the Buddha's teachings.

analyzed: ye buddhakṣetreṣu akārṣi pūjām caryāsu śikṣiṣu
translated: Who have made offerings in the Buddha-fields and trained in the conduct of the lords of the three worlds.

analyzed: aneka buddhāna pi no gatī buddhasya jñāne hi prakāśyamāne

analyzed: na ca buddha jñānasya labhyate tathā hi jñāna āścaryam jinānām

analyzed: tasmāt naraḥ yaḥ vākyam abhiśraddadheya
translated: Therefore, a wise and learned person who has faith in my words,

analyzed: kṛtsnām sa sākṣāt jina jñāna mārgān buddhaḥ girām udīrayet
translated: The Buddha, directly knowing the entire path to the Victor's wisdom, would speak these words.

analyzed: kadācid manuṣya lābhaḥ kadācid prādurbhāvaḥ

analyzed: sukhu vaidya

original: bhagavato 'mitābhasya tathāgatasya sukhāvatīguṇavarṇaparikīrtanaṃ bodhisattvānāmavaivartyabhūmipraveśaḥ amitābhasya parivartaḥ sukhāvatīvyūho
analyzed: bhagavataḥ mitābhasya tathāgatasya sukhāvatī guṇa varṇa parikīrtanam bodhisattvānām avaivartya bhūmi praveśaḥ amitābhasya parivartaḥ sukhāvatī vyūhaḥ
translated: The praise of the qualities of the blissful land of the Tathāgata Amitābha, and the entry of the bodhisattvas into the stage of nonretrogression, is the chapter on Amitābha, the array of the blissful land.

analyzed: mahāyāna sūtram samāptam
translated: The Mahāyāna Sūtra is complete.

original: ye dharmā hetuprabhavā hetuṃ teṣāṃ tathāgato hyavadat /
analyzed: ye dharmāḥ hetu prabhavāḥ hetum teṣām tathāgataḥ hi avadat
translated: Those dharmas that arise from causes, the Tathāgata has declared the cause of those.

original: teṣāṃ ca yo nirodha evaṃ vādī mahāśramaṇaḥ //
analyzed: teṣām ca yaḥ nirodhaḥ evam vādī mahā śramaṇaḥ
translated: And for those, the cessation of suffering, thus spoke the Great Ascetic.
